text: Longworth Peak, 2,094 m, is a mountain in the Cariboo Land District in Robson Valley, British Columbia, Canada. The mountain is named for the placename on the Grand Trunk Pacific Railway. The mountain has a popular hiking trail spot called the Longworth Lookout. There is a unincorporated area below the mountain called Longworth, British Columbia. In 2016, a automated snow weather station was erected on the south west side of the mountain by the BC Ministry of Environment. ==References== Category:Canadian Rockies Category:Mountains of British Columbia Category:Northern Interior of British Columbia
title: Longworth Peak
